publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1788# Elaine Thomson: Donside Paper Company—That the Parliament notes the current difficulties experienced by the Scottish paper industry, in particular those facing Donside Paper Company in Aberdeen, and urges the Scottish Executive and Scottish Enterprise Grampian to work with all those involved to secure the future of the Donside paper mill and its workforce.
S1M-1788# Donside Paper Company (lodged on 23 March 2001) Brian Adam*, Rhoda Grant*
S1M-1788# Donside Paper Company (lodged on 23 March 2001) Irene Oldfather*, Irene McGugan*, Mike Watson*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-1788# Donside Paper Company (lodged on 23 March 2001) Richard Lochhead*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Nora Radcliffe*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-1788# Donside Paper Company (lodged on 23 March 2001) Hugh Henry*, Ian Jenkins*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mr Gil Paterson*

S1M-1788# Elaine Thomson: Donside Paper Company—That the Parliament notes the current difficulties experienced by the Scottish paper industry, in particular those facing Donside Paper Company in Aberdeen, and urges the Scottish Executive and Scottish Enterprise to work with all those involved to secure the future of the paper industry across Scotland. Supported by: Brian Adam, Rhoda Grant, Irene Oldfather, Irene McGugan, Mike Watson, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Richard Lochhead, Dr Elaine Murray, Nora Radcliffe, Tommy Sheridan, Hugh Henry, Ian Jenkins, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Gil Paterson
S1M-1788# Donside Paper Company (lodged on 23 March 2001) Mr Michael McMahon*
S1M-1788# Donside Paper Company (lodged on 23 March 2001) Dennis Canavan*
S1M-1788# Donside Paper Company (lodged on 23 March 2001) Trish Godman*, Janis Hughes*, Pauline McNeill*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Cathy Peattie*, Karen Whitefield*, Cathy Jamieson*
S1M-1788# Donside Paper Company (lodged on 23 March 2001) Bill Butler*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Bristow Muldoon*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Margaret Jamieson*
S1M-1788# Donside Paper Company (lodged on 23 March 2001) Mr David Davidson*

S1M-1788# Elaine Thomson: Donside Paper Company—That the Parliament notes the current difficulties experienced by the Scottish paper industry, in particular those facing Donside Paper Company in Aberdeen, and urges the Scottish Executive and Scottish Enterprise to work with all those involved to secure the future of the paper industry across Scotland. Supported by: Brian Adam, Rhoda Grant, Irene Oldfather, Irene McGugan, Mike Watson, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Richard Lochhead, Dr Elaine Murray, Nora Radcliffe, Tommy Sheridan, Hugh Henry, Ian Jenkins, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Michael McMahon, Dennis Canavan, Trish Godman, Janis Hughes, Pauline McNeill, Mr Frank McAveety, Cathy Peattie, Karen Whitefield, Cathy Jamieson, Bill Butler, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Bristow Muldoon, Mr John Home Robertson, Margaret Jamieson, Mr David Davidson
